citation.article-title: Propionispora hippei sp. nov., a novel Gram-negative, spore-forming anaerobe that produces propionic acid
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Propionispora hippei sp. nov.
Propionispora hippei (hip′.pe.i. N.L. gen. n. hippei named after Dr Hans-H. Hippe, DSMZ, for his numerous contributions to the cultivation and taxonomy of anaerobes).
Cells appear as vibrios to slightly curved rods in phase-contrast microscopy.
Spores are round and in terminal position; spore-forming cells are distinctly swollen.
Growth and fermentation substrates are glucose, fructose, mannitol, xylitol, erythritol and glycerol.
Propionic and acetic acids are the fermentation products.
Lactose, lactate, pyruvate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, 2,3-butanediol, ethanol, methanol and H2/CO2 are not used.
The species differs from P. vibrioides in its ability to ferment glucose and glycerol.
It depolymerizes the aliphatic polyesters of 1,3-propanediol or 1,4-butanediol and adipic acid, as well as poly(ε-caprolactone), without degrading the monomers.
The type strain is strain KST (=DSM 15287T=ATCC BAA-665T), isolated from an enrichment culture for decomposition of the aliphatic copolyester of 1,3-propanediol and adipic acid.
